item.title: Setup
item.description: Making your own Quartz Setting up Quartz requires a basic understanding of git. If you are unfamiliar, this resource is a great place to start! Forking A fork is a copy of a repository.

item.title: Editing Content in Quartz
item.description: Editing Quartz runs on top of Hugo so all notes are written in Markdown. Folder Structure Here’s a rough overview of what’s what. All content in your garden can found in the /content folder.

item.title: Obsidian Vault Integration
item.description: Setup Obsidian is the preferred way to use Quartz. You can either create a new Obsidian Vault or link one that your already have. New Vault If you don’t have an existing Vault, download Obsidian and create a new Vault in the /content folder that you created and cloned during the setup step.

item.title: Preview Changes
item.description: If you’d like to preview what your Quartz site looks like before deploying it to the internet, the following instructions guide you through installing the proper dependencies to run it locally.

item.title: Deploying Quartz to the Web
item.description: Hosting on GitHub Pages Quartz is designed to be effortless to deploy. If you forked and cloned Quartz directly from the repository, everything should already be good to go! Follow the steps below.

Go back home: ⭐ Main ⭐ Finished / Incomplete 1.1.1 - Be able to use top-down, bottom-up and modularisation approaches to solve problems. The top-down approach to problem-solving involves breaking down a large, complex problem into smaller and more manageable subproblems.
Go back home: ⭐ Main ⭐ Finished / Incomplete 1.2.1 Understand what algorithms are and how they are expressed An algorithm is a set of steps or procedures for solving a problem.

Go back home: [[⭐ Main ⭐]] Finished / Incomplete 2.1.1 Understand the use of, and need for, data types String a sequence of characters Character Unit of information that roughly corresponds to a grapheme, grapheme-like unit, or symbol, such as in an alphabet or syllabary in the written form of a natural language.

Go back home: [[⭐ Main ⭐]] Finished / Incomplete 2.2.1 - Understand the purpose of, and how to use, mathematical operators in program code and algorithms (add, subtract, divide, multiply, integer division, modulus) Mathematical operators are used in program code and algorithms to perform mathematical operations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.

Go back home: [[⭐ Main ⭐]] Finished / Incomplete 2.3.1 - Understand how to use text files for input and output of data To use text files for input and output of data in a program, you will need to follow a few basic steps.

Go back home: [[⭐ Main ⭐]] Finished / Incomplete 2.4.1 - Understand how sequence, selection (branching) and iteration are used within programs and algorithms A sequence is a set of instructions in a program or algorithm that are executed in a specific order.

Go back home: [[⭐ Main ⭐]] Finished / Incomplete 2.5.1 - Understand the benefits and drawbacks of using pre-written code. PROS It can save time and effort: Using pre-written code can save developers the time and effort of writing code from scratch.

Go back home: [[⭐ Main ⭐]] Finished / Incomplete 2.6.1 - Understand the need for different types of input validation and be able to write, interpret and debug code that makes use of these validation techniques Presence check A presence check makes sure that a critical field cannot be left blank, it must be filled in.
Go back home: [[⭐ Main ⭐]] Finished / Incomplete 2.7.1 - Understand the accepted style conventions (such as Python’s PEP 8) and how these are implemented to create readable and maintainable code.

Go back home: [[⭐ Main ⭐]] Finished / Incomplete 2.8.1 - Understand the fundamental importance of testing for all components Software Software ensures that a piece of software performs as expected and meets the requirements and specifications set forth by the developers.

Go back home: [[⭐ Main ⭐]] Finished / Incomplete 3.1.1 - Understand the ethical and moral issues that an increasing reliance on technology raises, and how organisations and individuals can respond to these challenges One way that organizations and individuals can respond to these challenges is by implementing policies and practices that promote responsible use of technology and digital services.

Go back home: [[⭐ Main ⭐]] Finished / Incomplete 3.2.1 - Understand how developments in digital technologies impact on organisations, individuals and society CLICK TO OPEN PDF RELATED TO AR, IOT, VR, AR: [[IOT,AR,VR,AI.

Go back home: [[⭐ Main ⭐]] Finished / Incomplete [[bcs-code-of-conduct.pdf]] [[Understand the purpose and role of codes.pdf]] [[The Institution of Analysts and Programmers.pdf]] 4.1.1 - Health and safety when working with computers Display screen regulations The Health and Safety (Display Screen Equipment) Regulations 1992 is the main piece of UK legislation that covers the use of display screen equipment, including computers, in the workplace.

Go back home: [[⭐ Main ⭐]] Finished / Incomplete [[bcs-code-of-conduct.pdf]] [[Understand the purpose and role of codes.pdf]] [[The Institution of Analysts and Programmers.pdf]] 4.2.1 - Understand the purpose and role of codes of conduct produced by professional bodies for the use of digital British Computer Society (BCS) Code of Conduct All members have responsibilities

##Go back home: [[⭐ Main ⭐]] Finished / Incomplete 7.2.1 - Understand the benefits and drawbacks of connecting devices to form networks Connecting devices to form networks, such as the Internet of Things (IoT), can have both benefits and drawbacks.

item.title: Callouts
item.description: Callout support Quartz supports the same Admonition-callout syntax as Obsidian. This includes 12 Distinct callout types (each with several aliases) Collapsable callouts See documentation on supported types and syntax here.

item.title: CJK + Latex Support (测试)
item.description: Chinese, Japanese, Korean Support 几乎在我们意识到之前，我们已经离开了地面。 우리가 그것을 알기도 전에 우리는 땅을 떠났습니다. 私たちがそれを知るほぼ前に、私たちは地面を離れていました。 Latex Block math works with two dollar signs $$...$$ $$f(x) = \int_{-\infty}^\infty f\hat(\xi),e^{2 \pi i \xi x} ,d\xi$$

item.title: Configuration
item.description: Configuration Quartz is designed to be extremely configurable. You can find the bulk of the configuration scattered throughout the repository depending on how in-depth you’d like to get. The majority of configuration can be found under data/config.

item.title: Custom Domain
item.description: Registrar This step is only applicable if you are using a custom domain! If you are using a <YOUR-USERNAME>.github.io domain, you can skip this step. For this last bit to take effect, you also need to create a CNAME record with the DNS provider you register your domain with (i.

item.title: Hosting with Docker
item.description: If you want to host Quartz on a machine without using a webpage hosting service, it may be easier to install Docker Compose and follow the instructions below than to install Quartz’s dependencies manually.

item.title: Ignoring Notes
item.description: Quartz Ignore Edit ignoreFiles in config.toml to include paths you’d like to exclude from being rendered. 1 2 3 4 5 6 ... ignoreFiles = [ "/content/templates/*", "/content/private/*", "<your path here>" ] ignoreFiles supports the use of Regular Expressions (RegEx) so you can ignore patterns as well (e.

item.title: Quartz Philosophy
item.description: “[One] who works with the door open gets all kinds of interruptions, but [they] also occasionally gets clues as to what the world is and what might be important.” — Richard Hamming

item.title: Search
item.description: Quartz supports two modes of searching through content. Full-text Full-text search is the default in Quartz. It produces results that exactly match the search query. This is easier to setup but usually produces lower quality matches.

item.title: Showcase
item.description: Want to see what Quartz can do? Here are some cool community gardens :) Quartz Documentation (this site!) Jacky Zhao’s Garden Scaling Synthesis - A hypertext research notebook AWAGMI Intern Notes Shihyu’s PKM Chloe’s Garden SlRvb’s Site Course notes for Information Technology Advanced Theory Brandon Boswell’s Garden Siyang’s Courtyard Data Dictionary 🧠 sspaeti.

item.title: Troubleshooting and FAQ
item.description: Still having trouble? Here are a list of common questions and problems people encounter when installing Quartz. While you’re here, join our Discord :) Does Quartz have Latex support? Yes! See CJK + Latex Support (测试) for a brief demo.

item.title: Updating
item.description: Haven’t updated Quartz in a while and want all the cool new optimizations? On Unix/Mac systems you can run the following command for a one-line update! This command will show you a log summary of all commits since you last updated, press q to acknowledge this.
